de.polygonal.ds.PriorityQueue

type
class
implements
Collection<T>
A priority queue is a heap specialized in managing prioritized data and provides additional methods for removing and re-prioritizing elements.

Constructor

new(?inverse : Bool, ?maxSize : Int)
parameters
inverse If false, a higher number equals a higher priority, otherwise the lower the number, the higher the priority.
maxSize The maximum allowed size of the priority queue. The default value of -1 does not impose a size constraint.

Instance Methods

clear() : Void

Removes all elements from this priority queue.
Call compact() afterwards to make all elements accessible for the garbage collector.

clone(assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError copier is null: element is not of type Cloneable (if debug flag is set).
Duplicates this priority queue.
If assign is true the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference. If assign is false and copier is null, the method assumes that all elements implement the Cloneable interface. In this case element.clone() is used for duplicating an element. Otherwise the method uses the copier function. The size of the duplicate is unbound (maxSize()=-1).

compact() : Void

To ensure the best possible performance, removing elements does not shrink the underlying container to the actual number of stored elements - they continue to exist even though they were removed. For that reason, calling compact() is needed to ensure that all removed elements can be garbage collected in the future.

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this priority queue contains x.

dequeue() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError The priority queue is empty (if debug flag is set).
Dequeues x.

enqueue(x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError xis null, the priority queue is full or x already exists (if debug flag is set).
Enqueues x.

front() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError The priority queue is empty (if debug flag is set).
Return the element with the highest priority.

isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this priority queue is empty.

iterator() : Iterator<T>

Iterates over all elements in this priority queue.

maxSize() : Int

The maximum allowed size of the priority queue. Once the maximum size is reached, enqueueing an element will fail with an error (if debug flag is set). A value of -1 indicates that the size is unbound. Always returns -1 if debug flag is not set.

remove(x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError The priority queue is empty or x does not exist (if debug flag is set).
Removes x.

reprioritize(x : T, newPriority : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError The priority queue is empty or x does not exist (if debug flag is set).
Assigns newPriority to x.

size() : Int

The total number of elements.

toArray(?output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

returns
The output array or a new array if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output array in a random order. The method creates a new array if output is not specified.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object. If compiled with -debug all elements are printed in the order the dequeue() method would return them.
Example: 

	  class PQObj implements de.polygonal.ds.Prioritizable
	  {
	    public var priority:Int;
	    public var position:Int;

	    public function new(priority:Int)
	    {
	      this.priority = priority;
	    }

	    public function toString():String
	    {
	      return Std.string(priority);
	    }
	  }
	  ...
	  var pq = new PriorityQueue(4);
	  pq.enqueue(new PQObj(5));
	  pq.enqueue(new PQObj(3));
	  pq.enqueue(new PQObj(0));
	  trace(pq); //output:

	  {PriorityQueue, size: 3}
	  |< front
	       0 -> 5
	       1 -> 3
	       2 -> 0
	  >|

toVector(?output : Vector<T>) : Vector<T>

returns
The output vector or a new vector if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output vector in a random order. The method creates a new vector if output is not specified.
